definitions.definition: a chemical, usually a liquid, that contains hydrogen and has a pH of less than seven. The hydrogen can be replaced by a metal to form a salt. Acids usually have a bitter sharp taste and can often burn holes in or damage things they touch.

examples.text: The acid burned a hole in her coat.
Stomach acids can break down the poison.
You will need a special chemical to neutralize the acid.

definitions.definition: a powerful illegal drug that affects people’s minds and makes them see and hear things that are not really there

examples.text: They smoke joints and drop acid.
He described the music as ‘Brahms on acid’.

wordOrigin: early 17th cent. (in the sense ‘sour-tasting’): from Latin acidus, from acere ‘be sour’.
